levels.title: Quantitative Methods
levels.subtitle: Statistical tools and mathematical foundations for investment analysis
levels.description: Master statistical methods, probability, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and data science techniques used in investment analysis.

levels.title: Economics
levels.subtitle: Micro and macroeconomic theory applied to financial markets
levels.description: Understand market structures, business cycles, monetary and fiscal policy, international trade, and exchange rate mechanics.

levels.title: Corporate Issuers
levels.subtitle: Corporate structure, governance, and capital allocation
levels.description: Analyze corporate governance, capital structure, working capital management, and business models for investment evaluation.

levels.title: Financial Statement Analysis
levels.subtitle: Analyzing financial statements for investment decisions
levels.description: Develop expertise in analyzing income statements, balance sheets, cash flows, and financial ratios across accounting standards.

levels.title: Equity Investments
levels.subtitle: Equity markets, valuation, and security analysis
levels.description: Learn equity market structure, security analysis, industry analysis, and valuation techniques for equity investments.

levels.title: Fixed Income
levels.subtitle: Bond markets, valuation, and risk management
levels.description: Master bond valuation, yield analysis, duration and convexity, credit analysis, and structured products.

levels.title: Derivatives
levels.subtitle: Forwards, futures, options, and swaps
levels.description: Understand derivative instruments, pricing models, and their applications in hedging and speculation.

levels.title: Alternative Investments
levels.subtitle: Private equity, real estate, hedge funds, and more
levels.description: Explore private equity, real estate, hedge funds, commodities, and digital assets as portfolio diversifiers.

levels.title: Portfolio Management
levels.subtitle: Portfolio theory, construction, and risk management
levels.description: Apply portfolio theory, risk management, and behavioral finance to construct and manage investment portfolios.

levels.title: Ethical and Professional Standards
levels.subtitle: CFA Institute Code of Ethics and Standards of Practice
levels.description: Apply the CFA Institute Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct to investment scenarios.

levels.title: Mock Exams
levels.subtitle: Full-length practice exams simulating real test conditions
levels.description: Test your knowledge with full-length mock exams that simulate the actual CFA exam experience.

level-1.title: Quantitative Methods
level-1.description: Master statistical methods, probability, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and data science techniques used in investment analysis.

level-1.title: QM.1: Rates and Returns
level-1.description: Interpret interest rates as required rates of return, discount rates, or opportunity costs. Calculate and compare different return measures.

level-1.title: QM.2: The Time Value of Money
level-1.description: Calculate present and future values of single sums, annuities, and uneven cash flows. Master TVM applications in finance.

level-1.title: QM.3: Statistical Measures of Asset Returns
level-1.description: Calculate and interpret measures of central tendency, dispersion, and shape for asset return distributions.

level-1.title: QM.4: Probability Trees and Conditional Expectations
level-1.description: Apply probability rules, construct probability trees, and calculate conditional expectations for investment analysis.

level-1.title: QM.5: Portfolio Mathematics
level-1.description: Calculate portfolio expected return and variance. Understand covariance, correlation, and diversification benefits.

level-1.title: QM.6: Simulation Methods
level-1.description: Describe Monte Carlo simulation and historical simulation for risk assessment and financial modeling.

level-1.title: QM.7: Estimation and Inference
level-1.description: Construct and interpret confidence intervals. Distinguish between point estimates and interval estimates.

level-1.title: QM.8: Hypothesis Testing
level-1.description: Formulate hypotheses, determine test statistics, and interpret p-values and significance levels.

level-1.title: QM.9: Parametric and Non-Parametric Tests
level-1.description: Apply parametric and non-parametric tests of independence. Understand when to use each type of test.

level-1.title: QM.10: Simple Linear Regression
level-1.description: Estimate and interpret regression coefficients, test hypotheses about regression parameters, and assess model fit.

level-1.title: QM.11: Introduction to Big Data Techniques
level-1.description: Describe big data, machine learning, and data science applications in investment management.

level-1.title: QM: Quantitative Methods Practice Drill
level-1.description: 25 practice problems covering all Quantitative Methods topics.

level-1.title: Quantitative Methods Checkpoint
level-1.description: Test your understanding across all Quantitative Methods topics before moving on.

level-2.title: Economics
level-2.description: Understand market structures, business cycles, monetary and fiscal policy, international trade, and exchange rate mechanics.

level-2.title: ECON.1: The Firm and Market Structures
level-2.description: Analyze perfect competition, monopolistic competition, oligopoly, and monopoly. Determine breakeven and shutdown points.

level-2.title: ECON.2: Understanding Business Cycles
level-2.description: Describe phases of the business cycle, leading/lagging indicators, and theories of business cycles.

level-2.title: ECON.3: Fiscal Policy
level-2.description: Describe fiscal policy tools, their implementation, and effects on the economy and investment markets.

level-2.title: ECON.4: Monetary Policy
level-2.description: Explain central bank roles, monetary policy tools, transmission mechanisms, and effects on the economy.

level-2.title: ECON.5: Introduction to Geopolitics
level-2.description: Describe geopolitical risk and its effects on economies, financial markets, and investment decisions.

level-2.title: ECON.6: International Trade
level-2.description: Describe the benefits of international trade, trade restrictions, and their impact on capital flows.

level-2.title: ECON.7: Capital Flows and the FX Market
level-2.description: Describe the foreign exchange market, balance of payments, and capital flow effects on exchange rates.

level-2.title: ECON.8: Exchange Rate Calculations
level-2.description: Calculate cross rates, forward rates, and interpret exchange rate quotations and bid-ask spreads.

level-2.title: ECON: Economics Practice Drill
level-2.description: 20 practice problems covering all Economics topics.

level-2.title: Economics Checkpoint
level-2.description: Test your understanding across all Economics topics before moving on.

level-3.title: Corporate Issuers
level-3.description: Analyze corporate governance, capital structure, working capital management, and business models for investment evaluation.

level-3.title: CI.1: Organizational Forms, Corporate Issuer Features, and Ownership
level-3.description: Compare organizational forms, describe issuer features, and analyze ownership structures.

level-3.title: CI.2: Investors and Other Stakeholders
level-3.description: Describe types of investors, stakeholder conflicts, and corporate responsibilities to stakeholders.

level-3.title: CI.3: Corporate Governance
level-3.description: Analyze corporate governance mechanisms, board structures, conflicts of interest, and ESG considerations.

level-3.title: CI.4: Working Capital and Liquidity
level-3.description: Calculate and interpret working capital metrics. Evaluate a company's liquidity position and short-term financing.

level-3.title: CI.5: Capital Investments and Capital Allocation
level-3.description: Calculate NPV, IRR, and payback period. Evaluate capital budgeting decisions and project selection.

level-3.title: CI.6: Capital Structure
level-3.description: Describe Modigliani-Miller propositions, target capital structure, and the effects of leverage on cost of capital.

level-3.title: CI.7: Business Models
level-3.description: Describe and analyze different business models, revenue models, and their implications for company valuation.

level-3.title: CORP: Corporate Issuers Practice Drill
level-3.description: 20 practice problems covering all Corporate Issuers topics.

level-3.title: Corporate Issuers Checkpoint
level-3.description: Test your understanding across all Corporate Issuers topics before moving on.

level-4.title: Financial Statement Analysis
level-4.description: Develop expertise in analyzing income statements, balance sheets, cash flows, and financial ratios across accounting standards.

level-4.title: FSA.1: Introduction to Financial Statement Analysis
level-4.description: Describe the financial statement analysis framework, regulatory filings, and key information sources.

level-4.title: FSA.2: Analyzing Income Statements
level-4.description: Analyze revenue recognition, expense recognition, and non-recurring items on the income statement.

level-4.title: FSA.3: Analyzing Balance Sheets
level-4.description: Analyze current and non-current assets, liabilities, and equity. Compare IFRS and US GAAP treatments.

level-4.title: FSA.4: Analyzing Statements of Cash Flow I
level-4.description: Classify cash flows as operating, investing, or financing. Compare direct and indirect methods.

level-4.title: FSA.5: Analyzing Statements of Cash Flow II
level-4.description: Calculate free cash flow measures and analyze cash flow patterns for financial health assessment.

level-4.title: FSA.6: Analysis of Inventories
level-4.description: Compare FIFO, LIFO, and weighted average inventory methods. Analyze inventory valuation effects on financial statements.

level-4.title: FSA.7: Analysis of Long-Term Assets
level-4.description: Analyze capitalization vs. expensing, depreciation methods, impairment, and derecognition of long-lived assets.

level-4.title: FSA.8: Topics in Long-Term Liabilities and Equity
level-4.description: Analyze bond accounting, lease accounting, and equity transactions on financial statements.

level-4.title: FSA.9: Analysis of Income Taxes
level-4.description: Analyze deferred tax assets and liabilities, tax rate reconciliation, and tax-related financial statement effects.

level-4.title: FSA.10: Financial Reporting Quality
level-4.description: Distinguish between conservative and aggressive accounting. Identify warning signs of low-quality reporting.

level-4.title: FSA.11: Financial Analysis Techniques
level-4.description: Calculate and interpret financial ratios, perform common-size analysis, and conduct DuPont decomposition.

level-4.title: FSA.12: Introduction to Financial Statement Modeling
level-4.description: Build basic financial statement models and forecasts using income statement, balance sheet, and cash flow projections.

level-4.title: FSA: Financial Statement Analysis Practice Drill
level-4.description: 30 practice problems covering all Financial Statement Analysis topics.

level-4.title: Financial Statement Analysis Checkpoint
level-4.description: Test your understanding across all Financial Statement Analysis topics before moving on.

level-5.title: Equity Investments
level-5.description: Learn equity market structure, security analysis, industry analysis, and valuation techniques for equity investments.

level-5.title: EQ.1: Market Organization and Structure
level-5.description: Describe financial market structures, order types, and market participants. Compare exchange vs. OTC markets.

level-5.title: EQ.2: Security Market Indices
level-5.description: Calculate and interpret price-weighted, value-weighted, and equal-weighted indices. Understand index construction.

level-5.title: EQ.3: Market Efficiency
level-5.description: Describe the efficient market hypothesis, its forms, and implications for investment management.

level-5.title: EQ.4: Introduction to Equity Securities
level-5.description: Describe types of equity securities, shareholder rights, and the role of equity in company capital structure.

level-5.title: EQ.5: Introduction to Company Analysis
level-5.description: Describe elements of company analysis including competitive positioning, financial condition, and forecasting.

level-5.title: EQ.6: Industry and Competitive Analysis
level-5.description: Analyze industry life cycles, competitive forces, and strategic groupings for investment analysis.

level-5.title: EQ.7: Company Analysis: Forecasting
level-5.description: Build company revenue, earnings, and cash flow forecasts. Analyze growth drivers and forecast assumptions.

level-5.title: EQ.8: Equity Valuation: Concepts and Basic Tools
level-5.description: Apply dividend discount models, free cash flow models, and price multiples to value equity securities.

level-5.title: EQ: Equity Investments Practice Drill
level-5.description: 25 practice problems covering all Equity Investments topics.

level-5.title: Equity Investments Checkpoint
level-5.description: Test your understanding across all Equity Investments topics before moving on.

level-6.title: Fixed Income
level-6.description: Master bond valuation, yield analysis, duration and convexity, credit analysis, and structured products.

level-6.title: FI.1: Fixed-Income Instrument Features
level-6.description: Describe bond features including coupon structures, day-count conventions, and embedded options.

level-6.title: FI.2: Fixed-Income Cash Flows and Types
level-6.description: Describe fixed-income cash flow structures including bullet, amortizing, and sinking fund bonds.

level-6.title: FI.3: Fixed-Income Issuance and Trading
level-6.description: Describe primary and secondary bond markets, trading mechanisms, and settlement procedures.

level-6.title: FI.4: Fixed-Income Markets for Corporate Issuers
level-6.description: Describe corporate bond features, credit enhancements, and types of corporate debt instruments.

level-6.title: FI.5: Fixed-Income Markets for Government Issuers
level-6.description: Describe sovereign bonds, agency bonds, and government-related securities across major markets.

level-6.title: FI.6: Bond Valuation: Prices and Yields
level-6.description: Calculate bond prices using present value of cash flows. Understand the inverse price-yield relationship.

level-6.title: FI.7: Yield and Yield Spread Measures for Fixed-Rate Bonds
level-6.description: Calculate current yield, YTM, YTC, and yield spreads. Compare different yield measures.

level-6.title: FI.8: Yield and Yield Spread Measures for Floating-Rate Instruments
level-6.description: Calculate quoted margin, discount margin, and analyze floating-rate note valuation and risk.

level-6.title: FI.9: The Term Structure of Interest Rates
level-6.description: Describe yield curve shapes, spot rates, forward rates, and theories of the term structure.

level-6.title: FI.10: Interest Rate Risk and Return
level-6.description: Describe sources of bond return, interest rate risk, reinvestment risk, and the investment horizon effect.

level-6.title: FI.11: Yield-Based Bond Duration Measures
level-6.description: Calculate and interpret Macaulay duration, modified duration, and money duration. Understand duration properties.

level-6.title: FI.12: Yield-Based Bond Convexity
level-6.description: Calculate and interpret convexity. Use duration and convexity together to estimate bond price changes.

level-6.title: FI.13: Curve-Based and Empirical Risk Measures
level-6.description: Calculate effective duration, key rate duration, and empirical duration. Compare yield-based and curve-based measures.

level-6.title: FI.14: Credit Risk
level-6.description: Describe credit risk components: default probability, loss given default, and expected loss. Analyze credit spreads.

level-6.title: FI.15: Credit Analysis for Government Issuers
level-6.description: Evaluate sovereign credit risk using economic, institutional, and fiscal indicators.

level-6.title: FI.16: Credit Analysis for Corporate Issuers
level-6.description: Apply the four Cs of credit analysis. Calculate and interpret key credit ratios and covenants.

level-6.title: FI.17: Fixed-Income Securitization
level-6.description: Describe the securitization process, SPVs, credit enhancement, and the benefits and risks of securitized products.

level-6.title: FI.18: Asset-Backed Securities
level-6.description: Describe ABS features, structures, and performance metrics including auto loans, credit cards, and CLOs.

level-6.title: FI.19: Mortgage-Backed Securities
level-6.description: Describe MBS features, prepayment risk, CMO structures, and analysis of mortgage pass-through securities.

level-6.title: FI: Fixed Income Practice Drill
level-6.description: 30 practice problems covering all Fixed Income topics.

level-6.title: Fixed Income Checkpoint
level-6.description: Test your understanding across all Fixed Income topics before moving on.

level-7.title: Derivatives
level-7.description: Understand derivative instruments, pricing models, and their applications in hedging and speculation.

level-7.title: DER.1: Derivative Instrument and Market Features
level-7.description: Define derivatives, describe derivative markets, and distinguish between exchange-traded and OTC derivatives.

level-7.title: DER.2: Forward Commitment and Contingent Claim Features
level-7.description: Compare forward commitments and contingent claims. Describe forwards, futures, swaps, and options.

level-7.title: DER.3: Derivative Benefits, Risks, and Uses
level-7.description: Describe benefits and risks of derivatives for issuers and investors. Analyze hedging and speculation uses.

level-7.title: DER.4: Arbitrage, Replication, and Cost of Carry
level-7.description: Explain arbitrage and replication concepts. Calculate the cost of carry and its role in derivative pricing.

level-7.title: DER.5: Pricing and Valuation of Forward Contracts
level-7.description: Calculate the price and value of equity, fixed-income, and currency forward contracts.

level-7.title: DER.6: Pricing and Valuation of Futures Contracts
level-7.description: Describe futures pricing, daily settlement, and the relationship between futures and forward prices.

level-7.title: DER.7: Pricing and Valuation of Swaps
level-7.description: Calculate the price and value of interest rate swaps, currency swaps, and equity swaps.

level-7.title: DER.8: Pricing and Valuation of Options
level-7.description: Describe factors affecting option values. Calculate option payoffs and explain option value boundaries.

level-7.title: DER.9: Option Replication Using Put-Call Parity
level-7.description: Derive and apply put-call parity. Create synthetic positions using options and underlying assets.

level-7.title: DER.10: Valuing a Derivative Using a One-Period Binomial Model
level-7.description: Price options using the one-period binomial model. Calculate risk-neutral probabilities and hedge ratios.

level-7.title: DERIV: Derivatives Practice Drill
level-7.description: 25 practice problems covering all Derivatives topics.

level-7.title: Derivatives Checkpoint
level-7.description: Test your understanding across all Derivatives topics before moving on.

level-8.title: Alternative Investments
level-8.description: Explore private equity, real estate, hedge funds, commodities, and digital assets as portfolio diversifiers.

level-8.title: ALT.1: Alternative Investment Features, Methods, and Structures
level-8.description: Describe alternative investment categories, structures, fee arrangements, and due diligence considerations.

level-8.title: ALT.2: Alternative Investment Performance and Returns
level-8.description: Calculate and interpret alternative investment return measures including IRR, MOIC, and time-weighted returns.

level-8.title: ALT.3: Investments in Private Capital: Equity and Debt
level-8.description: Describe private equity and private debt strategies, structures, and performance measurement.

level-8.title: ALT.4: Real Estate and Infrastructure
level-8.description: Describe real estate investment forms, infrastructure investments, and valuation approaches.

level-8.title: ALT.5: Natural Resources
level-8.description: Describe commodity investments, farmland, timberland, and their roles in portfolio diversification.

level-8.title: ALT.6: Hedge Funds
level-8.description: Describe hedge fund strategies, structures, fee arrangements, and risk characteristics.

level-8.title: ALT.7: Introduction to Digital Assets
level-8.description: Describe digital assets, blockchain technology, and the investment features of cryptocurrencies and tokens.

level-8.title: ALT: Alternative Investments Practice Drill
level-8.description: 20 practice problems covering all Alternative Investments topics.

level-8.title: Alternative Investments Checkpoint
level-8.description: Test your understanding across all Alternative Investments topics before moving on.

level-9.title: Portfolio Management
level-9.description: Apply portfolio theory, risk management, and behavioral finance to construct and manage investment portfolios.

level-9.title: PM.1: Portfolio Risk and Return: Part I
level-9.description: Calculate and interpret portfolio risk and return measures. Understand diversification and the efficient frontier.

level-9.title: PM.2: Portfolio Risk and Return: Part II
level-9.description: Describe the CAPM, systematic vs. unsystematic risk, beta, and the security market line.

level-9.title: PM.3: Portfolio Management: An Overview
level-9.description: Describe the portfolio management process, investment policy statements, and asset allocation.

level-9.title: PM.4: Basics of Portfolio Planning and Construction
level-9.description: Create an investment policy statement. Describe strategic and tactical asset allocation approaches.

level-9.title: PM.5: The Behavioral Biases of Individuals
level-9.description: Describe cognitive errors and emotional biases that affect investment decision-making.

level-9.title: PM.6: Introduction to Risk Management
level-9.description: Describe the risk management process, risk governance, and risk measurement tools including VaR.

level-9.title: PM: Portfolio Management Practice Drill
level-9.description: 20 practice problems covering all Portfolio Management topics.

level-9.title: Portfolio Management Checkpoint
level-9.description: Test your understanding across all Portfolio Management topics before moving on.

level-10.title: Ethical and Professional Standards
level-10.description: Apply the CFA Institute Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct to investment scenarios.

level-10.title: ETH.1: Ethics and Trust in the Investment Profession
level-10.description: Describe the importance of ethics and trust in the investment profession. Analyze ethical frameworks.

level-10.title: ETH.2: Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct
level-10.description: Describe the CFA Institute Code of Ethics and the Standards of Professional Conduct.

level-10.title: ETH.3: Guidance for Standards I-VII
level-10.description: Apply the Standards of Professional Conduct with detailed guidance, recommended procedures, and examples.

level-10.title: ETH.4: Introduction to the Global Investment Performance Standards
level-10.description: Describe the GIPS standards, their purpose, and key requirements for performance reporting.

level-10.title: ETH.5: Ethics Application
level-10.description: Apply ethical decision-making frameworks to real-world investment scenarios and case studies.

level-10.title: ETHICS: Ethical and Professional Standards Practice Drill
level-10.description: 25 practice problems covering all Ethical and Professional Standards topics.

level-10.title: Ethics Checkpoint
level-10.description: Test your understanding across all Ethical and Professional Standards topics before moving on.

level-11.title: Mock Exams
level-11.description: Test your knowledge with full-length mock exams that simulate the actual CFA exam experience.

level-11.title: CFA Level I Mock Exam — Morning Session
level-11.description: 45-question morning session mock exam covering all CFA Level I topics with approximate exam weighting.

level-11.title: CFA Level I Mock Exam — Afternoon Session
level-11.description: 45-question afternoon session mock exam covering all CFA Level I topics with approximate exam weighting.
